02417   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02418   // Case changing functions
02419   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02420 
02421     MYTYPE& ToUpper(const std::locale& loc=std::locale())
02422   {
02423     // Note -- if there are any MBCS character sets in which the lowercase
02424     // form a character takes up a different number of bytes than the
02425     // uppercase form, this would probably not work...
02426 
02427     std::transform(this->begin(),
02428              this->end(),
02429              this->begin(),
02430 #ifdef SS_NO_LOCALE
02431              SSToUpper<CT>());
02432 #else
02433              std::bind2nd(SSToUpper<CT>(), loc));
02434 #endif
02435 
02436     // ...but if it were, this would probably work better.  Also, this way
02437     // seems to be a bit faster when anything other then the "C" locale is
02438     // used...
02439 
02440 //    if ( !empty() )
02441 //    {
02442 //      ssupr(this->GetBuf(), this->size(), loc);
02443 //      this->RelBuf();
02444 //    }
02445 
02446     return *this;
02447   }
02448 
02449   MYTYPE& ToLower(const std::locale& loc=std::locale())
02450   {
02451     // Note -- if there are any MBCS character sets in which the lowercase
02452     // form a character takes up a different number of bytes than the
02453     // uppercase form, this would probably not work...
02454 
02455     std::transform(this->begin(),
02456              this->end(),
02457              this->begin(),
02458 #ifdef SS_NO_LOCALE
02459              SSToLower<CT>());
02460 #else
02461              std::bind2nd(SSToLower<CT>(), loc));
02462 #endif
02463 
02464     // ...but if it were, this would probably work better.  Also, this way
02465     // seems to be a bit faster when anything other then the "C" locale is
02466     // used...
02467 
02468 //    if ( !empty() )
02469 //    {
02470 //      sslwr(this->GetBuf(), this->size(), loc);
02471 //      this->RelBuf();
02472 //    }
02473     return *this;
02474   }
02475 
02476 
02477   MYTYPE& Normalize()
02478   {
02479     return Trim().ToLower();
02480   }
02481 
02482 
02483   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02484   // CStdStr -- Direct access to character buffer.  In the MS' implementation,
02485   // the at() function that we use here also calls _Freeze() providing us some
02486   // protection from multithreading problems associated with ref-counting.
02487     // In VC 7 and later, of course, the ref-counting stuff is gone.
02488   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02489 
02490   CT* GetBuf(int nMinLen=-1)
02491   {
02492     if ( static_cast<int>(this->size()) < nMinLen )
02493       this->resize(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nMinLen));
02494 
02495     return this->empty() ? const_cast<CT*>(this->data()) : &(this->at(0));
02496   }
02497 
02498   CT* SetBuf(int nLen)
02499   {
02500     nLen = ( nLen > 0 ? nLen : 0 );
02501     if ( this->capacity() < 1 && nLen == 0 )
02502       this->resize(1);
02503 
02504     this->resize(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nLen));
02505     return const_cast<CT*>(this->data());
02506   }
02507   void RelBuf(int nNewLen=-1)
02508   {
02509     this->resize(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nNewLen > -1 ? nNewLen :
02510                                                         sslen(this->c_str())));
02511   }
02512 
02513   void BufferRel()     { RelBuf(); }      // backwards compatability
02514   CT*  Buffer()      { return GetBuf(); } // backwards compatability
02515   CT*  BufferSet(int nLen) { return SetBuf(nLen);}// backwards compatability
02516 
02517   bool Equals(const CT* pT, bool bUseCase=false) const
02518   {
02519     return  0 == (bUseCase ? this->compare(pT) : ssicmp(this->c_str(), pT));
02520   } 
02521 
02522   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02523   // FUNCTION:  CStdStr::Load
02524   // REMARKS:
02525   //    Loads string from resource specified by nID
02526   //
02527   // PARAMETERS:
02528   //    nID - resource Identifier.  Purely a Win32 thing in this case
02529   //
02530   // RETURN VALUE:
02531   //    true if successful, false otherwise
02532   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02533 
02534 #ifndef SS_ANSI
02535 
02536   bool Load(UINT nId, HMODULE hModule=NULL)
02537   {
02538     bool bLoaded    = false;  // set to true of we succeed.
02539 
02540   #ifdef _MFC_VER   // When in Rome (or MFC land)...
02541 
02542     // If they gave a resource handle, use it.  Note - this is archaic
02543     // and not really what I would recommend.  But then again, in MFC
02544     // land, you ought to be using CString for resources anyway since
02545     // it walks the resource chain for you.
02546 
02547     HMODULE hModuleOld = NULL;
02548 
02549     if ( NULL != hModule )
02550     {
02551       hModuleOld = AfxGetResourceHandle();
02552       AfxSetResourceHandle(hModule);
02553     }
02554 
02555     // ...load the string
02556 
02557     CString strRes;
02558     bLoaded       = FALSE != strRes.LoadString(nId);
02559 
02560     // ...and if we set the resource handle, restore it.
02561 
02562     if ( NULL != hModuleOld )
02563       AfxSetResourceHandle(hModule);
02564 
02565     if ( bLoaded )
02566       *this     = strRes;
02567 
02568   #else // otherwise make our own hackneyed version of CString's Load
02569     
02570     // Get the resource name and module handle
02571 
02572     if ( NULL == hModule )
02573       hModule     = GetResourceHandle();
02574 
02575     PCTSTR szName   = MAKEINTRESOURCE((nId>>4)+1); // lifted 
02576     DWORD dwSize    = 0;
02577 
02578     // No sense continuing if we can't find the resource
02579 
02580     HRSRC hrsrc     = ::FindResource(hModule, szName, RT_STRING);
02581 
02582     if ( NULL == hrsrc )
02583     {
02584       TRACE(_T("Cannot find resource %d: 0x%X"), nId, ::GetLastError());
02585     }
02586     else if ( 0 == (dwSize = ::SizeofResource(hModule, hrsrc) / sizeof(CT)))
02587     {
02588       TRACE(_T("Cant get size of resource %d 0x%X\n"),nId,GetLastError());
02589     }
02590     else
02591     {
02592       bLoaded     = 0 != ssload(hModule, nId, GetBuf(dwSize), dwSize);
02593       ReleaseBuffer();
02594     }
02595 
02596   #endif  // #ifdef _MFC_VER
02597 
02598     if ( !bLoaded )
02599       TRACE(_T("String not loaded 0x%X\n"), ::GetLastError());
02600 
02601     return bLoaded;
02602   }
02603 
02604 #endif  // #ifdef SS_ANSI
02605   
02606   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02607   // FUNCTION:  CStdStr::Format
02608   //    void _cdecl Formst(CStdStringA& PCSTR szFormat, ...)
02609   //    void _cdecl Format(PCSTR szFormat);
02610   //           
02611   // DESCRIPTION:
02612   //    This function does sprintf/wsprintf style formatting on CStdStringA
02613   //    objects.  It looks a lot like MFC's CString::Format.  Some people
02614   //    might even call this identical.  Fortunately, these people are now
02615   //    dead... heh heh.
02616   //
02617   // PARAMETERS: 
02618   //    nId - ID of string resource holding the format string
02619   //    szFormat - a PCSTR holding the format specifiers
02620   //    argList - a va_list holding the arguments for the format specifiers.
02621   //
02622   // RETURN VALUE:  None.
02623   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
02624   // formatting (using wsprintf style formatting)
02625 
02626     // If they want a Format() function that safely handles string objects
02627     // without casting
02628  
02629 #ifdef SS_SAFE_FORMAT       
02630     
02631     // Question:  Joe, you wacky coder you, why do you have so many overloads
02632     //      of the Format() function
02633     // Answer:  One reason only - CString compatability.  In short, by making
02634     //      the Format() function a template this way, I can do strong typing
02635     //      and allow people to pass CStdString arguments as fillers for
02636     //      "%s" format specifiers without crashing their program!  The downside
02637     //      is that I need to overload on the number of arguments.   If you are
02638     //      passing more arguments than I have listed below in any of my
02639     //      overloads, just add another one.
02640     //
02641     //      Yes, yes, this is really ugly.  In essence what I am doing here is
02642     //      protecting people from a bad (and incorrect) programming practice
02643     //      that they should not be doing anyway.  I am protecting them from
02644     //      themselves.  Why am I doing this?  Well, if you had any idea the
02645     //      number of times I've been emailed by people about this
02646     //      "incompatability" in my code, you wouldn't ask.
02647 
02648   void Fmt(const CT* szFmt, ...)
02649   {
02650     va_list argList;
02651     va_start(argList, szFmt);
02652     FormatV(szFmt, argList);
02653     va_end(argList);
02654   }
02655 
02656 #ifndef SS_ANSI
02657 
02658     void Format(UINT nId)
02659     {
02660     MYTYPE strFmt;
02661     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) ) 
02662             this->swap(strFmt);
02663     }
02664     template<class A1>
02665     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v)
02666     {
02667     MYTYPE strFmt;
02668     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
02669             Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v)());
02670     }
02671     template<class A1, class A2>
02672     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2)
02673     {
02674     MYTYPE strFmt;
02675     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
02676            Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v1)(), FmtArg<A2>(v2)());
02677     }
02678     template<class A1, class A2, class A3>
02679     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2, const A3& v3)
02680     {
02681     MYTYPE strFmt;
02682     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
02683         {
02684             Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v1)(), FmtArg<A2>(v2)(),
02685             FmtArg<A3>(v3)());
02686         }
02687     }
02688     template<class A1, class A2, class A3, class A4>
02689     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2, const A3& v3,
02690                 const A4& v4)
02691     {
02692     MYTYPE strFmt;
02693     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
02694         {
02695             Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v1)(), FmtArg<A2>(v2)(),
02696                 FmtArg<A3>(v3)(), FmtArg<A4>(v4)());
02697         }
02698     }

02700     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2, const A3& v3,
02701                 const A4& v4, const A5& v5)
02702     {

02708         }
02709     }

02866     template<class A1, class A2, class A3, class A4, class A5, class A6,

02868         class A13, class A14, class A15, class A16>
02869     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2, const A3& v3,
02870                 const A4& v4, const A5& v5, const A6& v6, const A7& v7,
02871                 const A8& v8, const A9& v9, const A10& v10, const A11& v11,
02872                 const A12& v12, const A13& v13, const A14& v14, const A15& v15,
02873                 const A16& v16)
02874     {

02877         {
02878             Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v1)(), FmtArg<A2>(v2)(),
02879                 FmtArg<A3>(v3)(), FmtArg<A4>(v4)(), FmtArg<A5>(v5)(),
02880                 FmtArg<A6>(v6)(), FmtArg<A7>(v7)(), FmtArg<A8>(v8)(),
02881                 FmtArg<A9>(v9)(), FmtArg<A10>(v10)(),FmtArg<A11>(v11)(),
02882                 FmtArg<A12>(v12)(),FmtArg<A13>(v13)(),FmtArg<A14>(v14)(),
02883                 FmtArg<A15>(v15)(), FmtArg<A16>(v16)());
02884         }
02885     }
02886     template<class A1, class A2, class A3, class A4, class A5, class A6,
02887         class A7, class A8, class A9, class A10, class A11, class A12,
02888         class A13, class A14, class A15, class A16, class A17>
02889     void Format(UINT nId, const A1& v1, const A2& v2, const A3& v3,
02890                 const A4& v4, const A5& v5, const A6& v6, const A7& v7,
02891                 const A8& v8, const A9& v9, const A10& v10, const A11& v11,
02892                 const A12& v12, const A13& v13, const A14& v14, const A15& v15,
02893                 const A16& v16, const A17& v17)
02894     {
02895     MYTYPE strFmt;
02896     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
02897         {
02898             Fmt(strFmt, FmtArg<A1>(v1)(), FmtArg<A2>(v2)(),
02899                 FmtArg<A3>(v3)(), FmtArg<A4>(v4)(), FmtArg<A5>(v5)(),
02900                 FmtArg<A6>(v6)(), FmtArg<A7>(v7)(), FmtArg<A8>(v8)(),
02901                 FmtArg<A9>(v9)(), FmtArg<A10>(v10)(),FmtArg<A11>(v11)(),
02902                 FmtArg<A12>(v12)(),FmtArg<A13>(v13)(),FmtArg<A14>(v14)(),
02903                 FmtArg<A15>(v15)(),FmtArg<A16>(v16)(),FmtArg<A17>(v17)());
02904         }
02905     }
02906     
02907 #endif // #ifndef SS_ANSI
02908 
02909     // ...now the other overload of Format: the one that takes a string literal
02910 
02911     void Format(const CT* szFmt)
02912     {
02913         *this = szFmt;
02914     }

03097 #ifndef SS_ANSI
03098 
03099   void Format(UINT nId, ...)
03100   {
03101     va_list argList;
03102     va_start(argList, nId);
03103 
03104     MYTYPE strFmt;
03105     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
03106       FormatV(strFmt, argList);
03107 
03108     va_end(argList);
03109   }
03110     
03111 #endif  // #ifdef SS_ANSI
03112 
03113   void Format(const CT* szFmt, ...)
03114   {
03115     va_list argList;
03116     va_start(argList, szFmt);
03117     FormatV(szFmt, argList);
03118     va_end(argList);
03119   }
03120 
03121 #endif // #ifdef SS_SAFE_FORMAT
03122 
03123   void AppendFormat(const CT* szFmt, ...)
03124   {
03125     va_list argList;
03126     va_start(argList, szFmt);
03127     AppendFormatV(szFmt, argList);
03128     va_end(argList);
03129   }
03130 
03131   #define MAX_FMT_TRIES   5  // #of times we try 
03132   #define FMT_BLOCK_SIZE    2048 // # of bytes to increment per try
03133   #define BUFSIZE_1ST 256
03134   #define BUFSIZE_2ND 512
03135   #define STD_BUF_SIZE    1024
03136 
03137   // an efficient way to add formatted characters to the string.  You may only
03138   // add up to STD_BUF_SIZE characters at a time, though
03139   void AppendFormatV(const CT* szFmt, va_list argList)
03140   {
03141     CT szBuf[STD_BUF_SIZE];
03142     int nLen = ssnprintf(szBuf, STD_BUF_SIZE-1, szFmt, argList);
03143 
03144     if ( 0 < nLen )
03145       this->append(szBuf, nLen);
03146   }
03147 
03148   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03149   // FUNCTION:  FormatV
03150   //    void FormatV(PCSTR szFormat, va_list, argList);
03151   //           
03152   // DESCRIPTION:
03153   //    This function formats the string with sprintf style format-specs. 
03154   //    It makes a general guess at required buffer size and then tries
03155   //    successively larger buffers until it finds one big enough or a
03156   //    threshold (MAX_FMT_TRIES) is exceeded.
03157   //
03158   // PARAMETERS: 
03159   //    szFormat - a PCSTR holding the format of the output
03160   //    argList - a Microsoft specific va_list for variable argument lists
03161   //
03162   // RETURN VALUE: 
03163   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03164 
03165   void FormatV(const CT* szFormat, va_list argList)
03166   {
03167   #ifdef SS_ANSI
03168     MYTYPE str;
03169     int nLen  = sslen(szFormat) + STD_BUF_SIZE;
03170     ssnprintf(str.GetBuffer(nLen), nLen-1, szFormat, argList);
03171     str.ReleaseBuffer();
03172     *this = str;
03173 
03174   #else
03175 
03176     CT* pBuf      = NULL;
03177     int nChars      = 1;
03178     int nUsed     = 0;
03179     size_type nActual = 0;
03180     int nTry      = 0;
03181 
03182     do  
03183     {
03184       // Grow more than linearly (e.g. 512, 1536, 3072, etc)
03185 
03186       nChars      += ((nTry+1) * FMT_BLOCK_SIZE);
03187       pBuf      = reinterpret_cast<CT*>(_alloca(sizeof(CT)*nChars));
03188       nUsed     = ssnprintf(pBuf, nChars-1, szFormat, argList);
03189 
03190       // Ensure proper NULL termination.
03191 
03192       nActual     = nUsed == -1 ? nChars-1 : SSMIN(nUsed, nChars-1);
03193       pBuf[nActual]= '\0';
03194 
03195 
03196     } while ( nUsed < 0 && nTry++ < MAX_FMT_TRIES );
03197 
03198     // assign whatever we managed to format
03199 
03200     this->assign(pBuf, nActual);
03201 
03202   #endif
03203   }
03204 
03205   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03206   // CString Facade Functions:
03207   //
03208   // The following methods are intended to allow you to use this class as a
03209   // near drop-in replacement for CString.
03210   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03211   #ifdef SS_WIN32
03212     BSTR AllocSysString() const
03213     {
03214       ostring os;
03215       ssasn(os, *this);
03216       return ::SysAllocString(os.c_str());
03217     }
03218   #endif
03219 
03220 #ifndef SS_NO_LOCALE
03221   int Collate(PCMYSTR szThat) const
03222   {
03223     return sscoll(this->c_str(), this->length(), szThat, sslen(szThat));
03224   }
03225 
03226   int CollateNoCase(PCMYSTR szThat) const
03227   {
03228     return ssicoll(this->c_str(), this->length(), szThat, sslen(szThat));
03229   }
03230 #endif
03231   int Compare(PCMYSTR szThat) const
03232   {
03233     return this->compare(szThat); 
03234   }
03235 
03236   int CompareNoCase(PCMYSTR szThat) const
03237   {
03238     return ssicmp(this->c_str(), szThat);
03239   }
03240 
03241   int Delete(int nIdx, int nCount=1)
03242   {
03243         if ( nIdx < 0 )
03244       nIdx = 0;
03245 
03246     if ( nIdx < this->GetLength() )
03247       this->erase(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx), static_cast<MYSIZE>(nCount));
03248 
03249     return GetLength();
03250   }
03251 
03252   void Empty()
03253   {
03254     this->erase();
03255   }
03256 
03257   int Find(CT ch) const
03258   {
03259     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_first_of(ch);
03260     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx  ? -1 : nIdx);
03261   }
03262 
03263   int Find(PCMYSTR szSub) const
03264   {
03265     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find(szSub);
03266     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03267   }
03268 
03269   int Find(CT ch, int nStart) const
03270   {
03271     // CString::Find docs say add 1 to nStart when it's not zero
03272     // CString::Find code doesn't do that however.  We'll stick
03273     // with what the code does
03274 
03275     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_first_of(ch, static_cast<MYSIZE>(nStart));
03276     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03277   }
03278 
03279   int Find(PCMYSTR szSub, int nStart) const
03280   {
03281     // CString::Find docs say add 1 to nStart when it's not zero
03282     // CString::Find code doesn't do that however.  We'll stick
03283     // with what the code does
03284 
03285     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find(szSub, static_cast<MYSIZE>(nStart));
03286     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03287   }
03288 
03289   int FindOneOf(PCMYSTR szCharSet) const
03290   {
03291     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_first_of(szCharSet);
03292     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03293   }
03294 
03295 #ifndef SS_ANSI
03296   void FormatMessage(PCMYSTR szFormat, ...) throw(std::exception)
03297   {
03298     va_list argList;
03299     va_start(argList, szFormat);
03300     PMYSTR szTemp;
03301     if ( ssfmtmsg(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_STRING|FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER,
03302              szFormat, 0, 0,
03303              reinterpret_cast<PMYSTR>(&szTemp), 0, &argList) == 0 ||
03304        szTemp == 0 )
03305     {
03306       throw std::runtime_error("out of memory");
03307     }
03308     *this = szTemp;
03309     LocalFree(szTemp);
03310     va_end(argList);
03311   }
03312 
03313   void FormatMessage(UINT nFormatId, ...) throw(std::exception)
03314   {
03315     MYTYPE sFormat;
03316     VERIFY(sFormat.LoadString(nFormatId));
03317     va_list argList;
03318     va_start(argList, nFormatId);
03319     PMYSTR szTemp;
03320     if ( ssfmtmsg(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_STRING|FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER,
03321              sFormat, 0, 0,
03322              reinterpret_cast<PMYSTR>(&szTemp), 0, &argList) == 0 ||
03323       szTemp == 0)
03324     {
03325       throw std::runtime_error("out of memory");
03326     }
03327     *this = szTemp;
03328     LocalFree(szTemp);
03329     va_end(argList);
03330   }
03331 #endif
03332 
03333   // GetAllocLength -- an MSVC7 function but it costs us nothing to add it.
03334 
03335   int GetAllocLength()
03336   {
03337     return static_cast<int>(this->capacity());
03338   }
03339 
03340   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03341   // GetXXXX -- Direct access to character buffer
03342   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03343   CT GetAt(int nIdx) const
03344   {
03345     return this->at(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx));
03346   }
03347 
03348   CT* GetBuffer(int nMinLen=-1)
03349   {
03350     return GetBuf(nMinLen);
03351   }
03352 
03353   CT* GetBufferSetLength(int nLen)
03354   {
03355     return BufferSet(nLen);
03356   }
03357 
03358   // GetLength() -- MFC docs say this is the # of BYTES but
03359   // in truth it is the number of CHARACTERs (chars or wchar_ts)
03360   int GetLength() const
03361   {
03362     return static_cast<int>(this->length());
03363   }
03364   
03365   int Insert(int nIdx, CT ch)
03366   {
03367     if ( static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx) > this->size()-1 )
03368       this->append(1, ch);
03369     else
03370       this->insert(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx), 1, ch);
03371 
03372     return GetLength();
03373   }
03374   int Insert(int nIdx, PCMYSTR sz)
03375   {
03376     if ( static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx) >= this->size() )
03377       this->append(sz, static_cast<MYSIZE>(sslen(sz)));
03378     else
03379       this->insert(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx), sz);
03380 
03381     return GetLength();
03382   }
03383 
03384   bool IsEmpty() const
03385   {
03386     return this->empty();
03387   }
03388 
03389   MYTYPE Left(int nCount) const
03390   {
03391         // Range check the count.
03392 
03393     nCount = SSMAX(0, SSMIN(nCount, static_cast<int>(this->size())));
03394     return this->substr(0, static_cast<MYSIZE>(nCount)); 
03395   }
03396 
03397 #ifndef SS_ANSI
03398   bool LoadString(UINT nId)
03399   {
03400     return this->Load(nId);
03401   }
03402 #endif
03403 
03404   void MakeLower()
03405   {
03406     ToLower();
03407   }
03408 
03409   void MakeReverse()
03410   {
03411     std::reverse(this->begin(), this->end());
03412   }
03413 
03414   void MakeUpper()
03415   { 
03416     ToUpper();
03417   }
03418 
03419   MYTYPE Mid(int nFirst) const
03420   {
03421     return Mid(nFirst, this->GetLength()-nFirst);
03422   }
03423 
03424   MYTYPE Mid(int nFirst, int nCount) const
03425   {
03426     // CString does range checking here.  Since we're trying to emulate it,
03427     // we must check too.
03428 
03429     if ( nFirst < 0 )
03430       nFirst = 0;
03431     if ( nCount < 0 )
03432       nCount = 0;
03433 
03434     int nSize = static_cast<int>(this->size());
03435 
03436     if ( nFirst + nCount > nSize )
03437       nCount = nSize - nFirst;
03438 
03439     if ( nFirst > nSize )
03440       return MYTYPE();
03441 
03442     ASSERT(nFirst >= 0);
03443     ASSERT(nFirst + nCount <= nSize);
03444 
03445     return this->substr(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nFirst),
03446               static_cast<MYSIZE>(nCount));
03447   }
03448 
03449   void ReleaseBuffer(int nNewLen=-1)
03450   {
03451     RelBuf(nNewLen);
03452   }
03453 
03454   int Remove(CT ch)
03455   {
03456     MYSIZE nIdx   = 0;
03457     int nRemoved  = 0;
03458     while ( (nIdx=this->find_first_of(ch)) != MYBASE::npos )
03459     {
03460       this->erase(nIdx, 1);
03461       nRemoved++;
03462     }
03463     return nRemoved;
03464   }
03465 
03466   int Replace(CT chOld, CT chNew)
03467   {
03468     int nReplaced = 0;
03469 
03470     for ( MYITER iter=this->begin(); iter != this->end(); iter++ )
03471     {
03472       if ( *iter == chOld )
03473       {
03474         *iter = chNew;
03475         nReplaced++;
03476       }
03477     }
03478 
03479     return nReplaced;
03480   }
03481 
03482   int Replace(PCMYSTR szOld, PCMYSTR szNew)
03483   {
03484     int nReplaced   = 0;
03485     MYSIZE nIdx     = 0;
03486     MYSIZE nOldLen    = sslen(szOld);
03487 
03488     if ( 0 != nOldLen )
03489     {
03490       // If the replacement string is longer than the one it replaces, this
03491       // string is going to have to grow in size,  Figure out how much
03492       // and grow it all the way now, rather than incrementally
03493 
03494       MYSIZE nNewLen    = sslen(szNew);
03495       if ( nNewLen > nOldLen )
03496       {
03497         int nFound      = 0;
03498         while ( nIdx < this->length() &&
03499           (nIdx=this->find(szOld, nIdx)) != MYBASE::npos )
03500         {
03501           nFound++;
03502           nIdx += nOldLen;
03503         }
03504         this->reserve(this->size() + nFound * (nNewLen - nOldLen));
03505       }
03506 
03507 
03508       static const CT ch  = CT(0);
03509       PCMYSTR szRealNew = szNew == 0 ? &ch : szNew;
03510       nIdx        = 0;
03511 
03512       while ( nIdx < this->length() && 
03513         (nIdx=this->find(szOld, nIdx)) != MYBASE::npos )
03514       {
03515         this->replace(this->begin()+nIdx, this->begin()+nIdx+nOldLen,
03516           szRealNew);
03517 
03518         nReplaced++;
03519         nIdx += nNewLen;
03520       }
03521     }
03522 
03523     return nReplaced;
03524   }
03525 
03526   int ReverseFind(CT ch) const
03527   {
03528     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_last_of(ch);
03529     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03530   }
03531 
03532   // ReverseFind overload that's not in CString but might be useful
03533   int ReverseFind(PCMYSTR szFind, MYSIZE pos=MYBASE::npos) const
03534   {
03535     MYSIZE nIdx = this->rfind(0 == szFind ? MYTYPE() : szFind, pos);
03536     return static_cast<int>(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? -1 : nIdx);
03537   }
03538 
03539   MYTYPE Right(int nCount) const
03540   {
03541         // Range check the count.
03542 
03543     nCount = SSMAX(0, SSMIN(nCount, static_cast<int>(this->size())));
03544     return this->substr(this->size()-static_cast<MYSIZE>(nCount));
03545   }
03546 
03547   void SetAt(int nIndex, CT ch)
03548   {
03549     ASSERT(this->size() > static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIndex));
03550     this->at(static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIndex))   = ch;
03551   }
03552 
03553 #ifndef SS_ANSI
03554   BSTR SetSysString(BSTR* pbstr) const
03555   {
03556     ostring os;
03557     ssasn(os, *this);
03558     if ( !::SysReAllocStringLen(pbstr, os.c_str(), os.length()) )
03559       throw std::runtime_error("out of memory");
03560 
03561     ASSERT(*pbstr != 0);
03562     return *pbstr;
03563   }
03564 #endif
03565 
03566   MYTYPE SpanExcluding(PCMYSTR szCharSet) const
03567   {
03568         MYSIZE pos = this->find_first_of(szCharSet);
03569         return pos == MYBASE::npos ? *this : Left(pos);
03570   }
03571 
03572   MYTYPE SpanIncluding(PCMYSTR szCharSet) const
03573   {
03574         MYSIZE pos = this->find_first_not_of(szCharSet);
03575         return pos == MYBASE::npos ? *this : Left(pos);
03576   }
03577 
03578 #if defined SS_WIN32 && !defined(UNICODE) && !defined(SS_ANSI)
03579 
03580   // CString's OemToAnsi and AnsiToOem functions are available only in
03581   // Unicode builds.  However since we're a template we also need a
03582   // runtime check of CT and a reinterpret_cast to account for the fact
03583   // that CStdStringW gets instantiated even in non-Unicode builds.
03584 
03585   void AnsiToOem()
03586   {
03587     if ( sizeof(CT) == sizeof(char) && !empty() )
03588     {
03589       ::CharToOem(reinterpret_cast<PCSTR>(this->c_str()),
03590             reinterpret_cast<PSTR>(GetBuf()));
03591     }
03592     else
03593     {
03594       ASSERT(false);
03595     }
03596   }
03597 
03598   void OemToAnsi()
03599   {
03600     if ( sizeof(CT) == sizeof(char) && !empty() )
03601     {
03602       ::OemToChar(reinterpret_cast<PCSTR>(this->c_str()),
03603             reinterpret_cast<PSTR>(GetBuf()));
03604     }
03605     else
03606     {
03607       ASSERT(false);
03608     }
03609   }
03610 
03611 #endif
03612   
03613 
03614   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03615   // Trim and its variants
03616   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03617   MYTYPE& Trim()
03618   {
03619     return TrimLeft().TrimRight();
03620   }
03621 
03622   MYTYPE& TrimLeft()
03623   {
03624     this->erase(this->begin(),
03625       std::find_if(this->begin(), this->end(), NotSpace<CT>()));
03626 
03627     return *this;
03628   }
03629 
03630   MYTYPE&  TrimLeft(CT tTrim)
03631   {
03632     this->erase(0, this->find_first_not_of(tTrim));
03633     return *this;
03634   }
03635 
03636   MYTYPE&  TrimLeft(PCMYSTR szTrimChars)
03637   {
03638     this->erase(0, this->find_first_not_of(szTrimChars));
03639     return *this;
03640   }
03641 
03642   MYTYPE& TrimRight()
03643   {
03644     // NOTE:  When comparing reverse_iterators here (MYRITER), I avoid using
03645     // operator!=.  This is because namespace rel_ops also has a template
03646     // operator!= which conflicts with the global operator!= already defined
03647     // for reverse_iterator in the header <utility>.
03648     // Thanks to John James for alerting me to this.
03649 
03650     MYRITER it = std::find_if(this->rbegin(), this->rend(), NotSpace<CT>());
03651     if ( !(this->rend() == it) )
03652       this->erase(this->rend() - it);
03653 
03654     this->erase(!(it == this->rend()) ? this->find_last_of(*it) + 1 : 0);
03655     return *this;
03656   }
03657 
03658   MYTYPE&  TrimRight(CT tTrim)
03659   {
03660     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_last_not_of(tTrim);
03661     this->erase(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? 0 : ++nIdx);
03662     return *this;
03663   }
03664 
03665   MYTYPE&  TrimRight(PCMYSTR szTrimChars)
03666   {
03667     MYSIZE nIdx = this->find_last_not_of(szTrimChars);
03668     this->erase(MYBASE::npos == nIdx ? 0 : ++nIdx);
03669     return *this;
03670   }
03671 
03672   void      FreeExtra()
03673   {
03674     MYTYPE mt;
03675     this->swap(mt);
03676     if ( !mt.empty() )
03677       this->assign(mt.c_str(), mt.size());
03678   }
03679 
03680   // I have intentionally not implemented the following CString
03681   // functions.   You cannot make them work without taking advantage
03682   // of implementation specific behavior.  However if you absolutely
03683   // MUST have them, uncomment out these lines for "sort-of-like"
03684   // their behavior.  You're on your own.
03685 
03686 //  CT*       LockBuffer()  { return GetBuf(); }// won't really lock
03687 //  void      UnlockBuffer(); { } // why have UnlockBuffer w/o LockBuffer?
03688 
03689   // Array-indexing operators.  Required because we defined an implicit cast
03690   // to operator const CT* (Thanks to Julian Selman for pointing this out)
03691 
03692   CT& operator[](int nIdx)
03693   {
03694     return static_cast<MYBASE*>(this)->operator[](static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx));
03695   }
03696 
03697   const CT& operator[](int nIdx) const
03698   {
03699     return static_cast<const MYBASE*>(this)->operator[](static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx));
03700   }
03701 
03702   CT& operator[](unsigned int nIdx)
03703   {
03704     return static_cast<MYBASE*>(this)->operator[](static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx));
03705   }
03706 
03707   const CT& operator[](unsigned int nIdx) const
03708   {
03709     return static_cast<const MYBASE*>(this)->operator[](static_cast<MYSIZE>(nIdx));
03710   }
03711 
03712 #ifndef SS_NO_IMPLICIT_CAST
03713   operator const CT*() const
03714   {
03715     return this->c_str();
03716   }
03717 #endif
03718 
03719   // IStream related functions.  Useful in IPersistStream implementations
03720 
03721 #ifdef SS_INC_COMDEF
03722 
03723   // struct SSSHDR - useful for non Std C++ persistence schemes.
03724   typedef struct SSSHDR
03725   {
03726     BYTE  byCtrl;
03727     ULONG nChars;
03728   } SSSHDR; // as in "Standard String Stream Header"
03729 
03730   #define SSSO_UNICODE  0x01  // the string is a wide string
03731   #define SSSO_COMPRESS 0x02  // the string is compressed
03732 
03733   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03734   // FUNCTION: StreamSize
03735   // REMARKS:
03736   //    Returns how many bytes it will take to StreamSave() this CStdString
03737   //    object to an IStream.
03738   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03739   ULONG StreamSize() const
03740   {
03741     // Control header plus string
03742     ASSERT(this->size()*sizeof(CT) < 0xffffffffUL - sizeof(SSSHDR));
03743     return (this->size() * sizeof(CT)) + sizeof(SSSHDR);
03744   }
03745 
03746   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03747   // FUNCTION: StreamSave
03748   // REMARKS:
03749   //    Saves this CStdString object to a COM IStream.
03750   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03751   HRESULT StreamSave(IStream* pStream) const
03752   {
03753     ASSERT(this->size()*sizeof(CT) < 0xffffffffUL - sizeof(SSSHDR));
03754     HRESULT hr    = E_FAIL;
03755     ASSERT(pStream != 0);
03756     SSSHDR hdr;
03757     hdr.byCtrl    = sizeof(CT) == 2 ? SSSO_UNICODE : 0;
03758     hdr.nChars    = this->size();
03759 
03760 
03761     if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Write(&hdr, sizeof(SSSHDR), 0)) )
03762     {
03763       TRACE(_T("StreamSave: Cannot write control header, ERR=0x%X\n"),hr);
03764     }
03765     else if ( empty() )
03766     {
03767       ;   // nothing to write
03768     }
03769     else if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Write(this->c_str(),
03770       this->size()*sizeof(CT), 0)) )
03771     {
03772       TRACE(_T("StreamSave: Cannot write string to stream 0x%X\n"), hr);
03773     }
03774 
03775     return hr;
03776   }
03777 
03778 
03779   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03780   // FUNCTION: StreamLoad
03781   // REMARKS:
03782   //    This method loads the object from an IStream.
03783   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
03784   HRESULT StreamLoad(IStream* pStream)
03785   {
03786     ASSERT(pStream != 0);
03787     SSSHDR hdr;
03788     HRESULT hr      = E_FAIL;
03789 
03790     if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Read(&hdr, sizeof(SSSHDR), 0)) )
03791     {
03792       TRACE(_T("StreamLoad: Cant read control header, ERR=0x%X\n"), hr);
03793     }
03794     else if ( hdr.nChars > 0 )
03795     {
03796       ULONG nRead   = 0;
03797       PMYSTR pMyBuf = BufferSet(hdr.nChars);
03798 
03799       // If our character size matches the character size of the string
03800       // we're trying to read, then we can read it directly into our
03801       // buffer. Otherwise, we have to read into an intermediate buffer
03802       // and convert.
03803       
03804       if ( (hdr.byCtrl & SSSO_UNICODE) != 0 )
03805       {
03806         ULONG nBytes  = hdr.nChars * sizeof(wchar_t);
03807         if ( sizeof(CT) == sizeof(wchar_t) )
03808         {
03809           if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Read(pMyBuf, nBytes, &nRead)) )
03810             TRACE(_T("StreamLoad: Cannot read string: 0x%X\n"), hr);
03811         }
03812         else
03813         { 
03814           PWSTR pBufW = reinterpret_cast<PWSTR>(_alloca((nBytes)+1));
03815           if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Read(pBufW, nBytes, &nRead)) )
03816             TRACE(_T("StreamLoad: Cannot read string: 0x%X\n"), hr);
03817           else
03818             sscpy(pMyBuf, pBufW, hdr.nChars);
03819         }
03820       }
03821       else
03822       {
03823         ULONG nBytes  = hdr.nChars * sizeof(char);
03824         if ( sizeof(CT) == sizeof(char) )
03825         {
03826           if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Read(pMyBuf, nBytes, &nRead)) )
03827             TRACE(_T("StreamLoad: Cannot read string: 0x%X\n"), hr);
03828         }
03829         else
03830         {
03831           PSTR pBufA = reinterpret_cast<PSTR>(_alloca(nBytes));
03832           if ( FAILED(hr=pStream->Read(pBufA, hdr.nChars, &nRead)) )
03833             TRACE(_T("StreamLoad: Cannot read string: 0x%X\n"), hr);
03834           else
03835             sscpy(pMyBuf, pBufA, hdr.nChars);
03836         }
03837       }
03838     }
03839     else
03840     {
03841       this->erase();
03842     }
03843     return hr;
03844   }
03845 #endif // #ifdef SS_INC_COMDEF
03846 
03847 #ifndef SS_ANSI
03848 
03849   // SetResourceHandle/GetResourceHandle.  In MFC builds, these map directly
03850   // to AfxSetResourceHandle and AfxGetResourceHandle.  In non-MFC builds they
03851   // point to a single static HINST so that those who call the member
03852   // functions that take resource IDs can provide an alternate HINST of a DLL
03853   // to search.  This is not exactly the list of HMODULES that MFC provides
03854   // but it's better than nothing.
03855 
03856   #ifdef _MFC_VER
03857     static void SetResourceHandle(HMODULE hNew)
03858     {
03859       AfxSetResourceHandle(hNew);
03860     }
03861     static HMODULE GetResourceHandle()
03862     {
03863       return AfxGetResourceHandle();
03864     }
03865   #else
03866     static void SetResourceHandle(HMODULE hNew)
03867     {
03868       SSResourceHandle() = hNew;
03869     }
03870     static HMODULE GetResourceHandle()
03871     {
03872       return SSResourceHandle();
03873     }
03874   #endif
03875 
03876 #endif
03877 };
03878 
03879 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03880 // MSVC USERS: HOW TO EXPORT CSTDSTRING FROM A DLL
03881 //
03882 // If you are using MS Visual C++ and you want to export CStdStringA and
03883 // CStdStringW from a DLL, then all you need to
03884 //
03885 //    1.  make sure that all components link to the same DLL version
03886 //      of the CRT (not the static one).
03887 //    2.  Uncomment the 3 lines of code below
03888 //    3.  #define 2 macros per the instructions in MS KnowledgeBase
03889 //      article Q168958.  The macros are:
03890 //
03891 //    MACRO   DEFINTION WHEN EXPORTING    DEFINITION WHEN IMPORTING
03892 //    -----   ------------------------    -------------------------
03893 //    SSDLLEXP  (nothing, just #define it)    extern
03894 //    SSDLLSPEC __declspec(dllexport)     __declspec(dllimport)
03895 //
03896 //    Note that these macros must be available to ALL clients who want to 
03897 //    link to the DLL and use the class.  If they 
03898 //
03899 // A word of advice: Don't bother.
03900 //
03901 // Really, it is not necessary to export CStdString functions from a DLL.  I
03902 // never do.  In my projects, I do generally link to the DLL version of the
03903 // Standard C++ Library, but I do NOT attempt to export CStdString functions.
03904 // I simply include the header where it is needed and allow for the code
03905 // redundancy.
03906 //
03907 // That redundancy is a lot less than you think.  This class does most of its
03908 // work via the Standard C++ Library, particularly the base_class basic_string<>
03909 // member functions.  Most of the functions here are small enough to be inlined
03910 // anyway.  Besides, you'll find that in actual practice you use less than 1/2
03911 // of the code here, even in big projects and different modules will use as
03912 // little as 10% of it.  That means a lot less functions actually get linked
03913 // your binaries.  If you export this code from a DLL, it ALL gets linked in.
03914 //
03915 // I've compared the size of the binaries from exporting vs NOT exporting.  Take
03916 // my word for it -- exporting this code is not worth the hassle.
03917 //
03918 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03919 //#pragma warning(disable:4231) // non-standard extension ("extern template")
03920 //  SSDLLEXP template class SSDLLSPEC CStdStr<char>;
03921 //  SSDLLEXP template class SSDLLSPEC CStdStr<wchar_t>;
03922 
03923 
03924 // =============================================================================
03925 //            END OF CStdStr INLINE FUNCTION DEFINITIONS
03926 // =============================================================================
03927 
03928 //  Now typedef our class names based upon this humongous template
03929 
03930 typedef CStdStr<char>   CStdStringA;  // a better std::string
03931 typedef CStdStr<wchar_t>  CStdStringW;  // a better std::wstring
03932 typedef CStdStr<OLECHAR>  CStdStringO;  // almost always CStdStringW
03933 
03934 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03935 // CStdStr addition functions defined as inline
03936 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03937 
03938 
03939 inline CStdStringA operator+(const CStdStringA& s1, const CStdStringA& s2)
03940 {
03941   CStdStringA sRet(SSREF(s1));
03942   sRet.append(s2);
03943   return sRet;
03944 }
03945 inline CStdStringA operator+(const CStdStringA& s1, CStdStringA::value_type t)
03946 {
03947   CStdStringA sRet(SSREF(s1));
03948   sRet.append(1, t);
03949   return sRet;
03950 }
03951 inline CStdStringA operator+(const CStdStringA& s1, PCSTR pA)
03952 {
03953   CStdStringA sRet(SSREF(s1));
03954   sRet.append(pA);
03955   return sRet;
03956 }
03957 inline CStdStringA operator+(PCSTR pA, const CStdStringA& sA)
03958 {
03959   CStdStringA sRet;
03960   CStdStringA::size_type nObjSize = sA.size();
03961   CStdStringA::size_type nLitSize = 
03962     static_cast<CStdStringA::size_type>(sslen(pA));
03963 
03964   sRet.reserve(nLitSize + nObjSize);
03965   sRet.assign(pA);
03966   sRet.append(sA);
03967   return sRet;
03968 }
03969 
03970 
03971 inline CStdStringA operator+(const CStdStringA& s1, const CStdStringW& s2)
03972 {
03973   return s1 + CStdStringA(s2);
03974 }
03975 inline CStdStringW operator+(const CStdStringW& s1, const CStdStringW& s2)
03976 {
03977   CStdStringW sRet(SSREF(s1));
03978   sRet.append(s2);
03979   return sRet;
03980 }
03981 inline CStdStringA operator+(const CStdStringA& s1, PCWSTR pW)
03982 {
03983   return s1 + CStdStringA(pW);
03984 }
03985 
03986 #ifdef UNICODE
03987   inline CStdStringW operator+(PCWSTR pW, const CStdStringA& sA)
03988   {
03989     return CStdStringW(pW) + CStdStringW(SSREF(sA));
03990   }
03991   inline CStdStringW operator+(PCSTR pA, const CStdStringW& sW)
03992   {
03993     return CStdStringW(pA) + sW;
03994   }
03995 #else
03996   inline CStdStringA operator+(PCWSTR pW, const CStdStringA& sA)
03997   {
03998     return CStdStringA(pW) + sA;
03999   }
04000   inline CStdStringA operator+(PCSTR pA, const CStdStringW& sW)
04001   {
04002     return pA + CStdStringA(sW);
04003   }
04004 #endif
04005 
04006 // ...Now the wide string versions.
04007 inline CStdStringW operator+(const CStdStringW& s1, CStdStringW::value_type t)
04008 {
04009   CStdStringW sRet(SSREF(s1));
04010   sRet.append(1, t);
04011   return sRet;
04012 }
04013 inline CStdStringW operator+(const CStdStringW& s1, PCWSTR pW)
04014 {
04015   CStdStringW sRet(SSREF(s1));
04016   sRet.append(pW);
04017   return sRet;
04018 }
04019 inline CStdStringW operator+(PCWSTR pW, const CStdStringW& sW)
04020 {
04021   CStdStringW sRet;
04022   CStdStringW::size_type nObjSize = sW.size();
04023   CStdStringA::size_type nLitSize = 
04024     static_cast<CStdStringW::size_type>(sslen(pW));
04025 
04026   sRet.reserve(nLitSize + nObjSize);
04027   sRet.assign(pW);
04028   sRet.append(sW);
04029   return sRet;
04030 }
04031 
04032 inline CStdStringW operator+(const CStdStringW& s1, const CStdStringA& s2)
04033 {
04034   return s1 + CStdStringW(s2);
04035 }
04036 inline CStdStringW operator+(const CStdStringW& s1, PCSTR pA)
04037 {
04038   return s1 + CStdStringW(pA);
04039 }
04040 
04041 
04042 // New-style format function is a template
04043 
04044 #ifdef SS_SAFE_FORMAT
04045 
04046 template<>
04047 struct FmtArg<CStdStringA>
04048 {
04049     explicit FmtArg(const CStdStringA& arg) : a_(arg) {}
04050     PCSTR operator()() const { return a_.c_str(); }
04051     const CStdStringA& a_;
04052 private:
04053     FmtArg<CStdStringA>& operator=(const FmtArg<CStdStringA>&) { return *this; }
04054 };
04055 template<>
04056 struct FmtArg<CStdStringW>
04057 {
04058     explicit FmtArg(const CStdStringW& arg) : a_(arg) {}
04059     PCWSTR operator()() const { return a_.c_str(); }
04060     const CStdStringW& a_;
04061 private:
04062     FmtArg<CStdStringW>& operator=(const FmtArg<CStdStringW>&) { return *this; }
04063 };
04064 
04065 template<>
04066 struct FmtArg<std::string>
04067 {
04068     explicit FmtArg(const std::string& arg) : a_(arg) {}
04069     PCSTR operator()() const { return a_.c_str(); }
04070     const std::string& a_;
04071 private:
04072     FmtArg<std::string>& operator=(const FmtArg<std::string>&) { return *this; }
04073 };
04074 template<>
04075 struct FmtArg<std::wstring>
04076 {
04077     explicit FmtArg(const std::wstring& arg) : a_(arg) {}
04078     PCWSTR operator()() const { return a_.c_str(); }
04079     const std::wstring& a_;
04080 private:
04081     FmtArg<std::wstring>& operator=(const FmtArg<std::wstring>&) {return *this;}
04082 };
04083 #endif // #ifdef SS_SAFEFORMAT
04084 
04085 #ifndef SS_ANSI
04086   // SSResourceHandle: our MFC-like resource handle
04087   inline HMODULE& SSResourceHandle()
04088   {
04089     static HMODULE hModuleSS  = GetModuleHandle(0);
04090     return hModuleSS;
04091   }
04092 #endif

04095 // In MFC builds, define some global serialization operators
04096 // Special operators that allow us to serialize CStdStrings to CArchives.
04097 // Note that we use an intermediate CString object in order to ensure that
04098 // we use the exact same format.
04099 
04100 #ifdef _MFC_VER
04101   inline CArchive& AFXAPI operator<<(CArchive& ar, const CStdStringA& strA)
04102   {
04103     CString strTemp = strA;
04104     return ar << strTemp;
04105   }
04106   inline CArchive& AFXAPI operator<<(CArchive& ar, const CStdStringW& strW)
04107   {
04108     CString strTemp = strW;
04109     return ar << strTemp;
04110   }
04111 
04112   inline CArchive& AFXAPI operator>>(CArchive& ar, CStdStringA& strA)
04113   {
04114     CString strTemp;
04115     ar >> strTemp;
04116     strA = strTemp;
04117     return ar;
04118   }
04119   inline CArchive& AFXAPI operator>>(CArchive& ar, CStdStringW& strW)
04120   {
04121     CString strTemp;
04122     ar >> strTemp;
04123     strW = strTemp;
04124     return ar;
04125   }
04126 #endif  // #ifdef _MFC_VER -- (i.e. is this MFC?)
04127 
04128 
04129 
04130 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04131 // GLOBAL FUNCTION:  WUFormat
04132 //    CStdStringA WUFormat(UINT nId, ...);
04133 //    CStdStringA WUFormat(PCSTR szFormat, ...);
04134 //
04135 // REMARKS:
04136 //    This function allows the caller for format and return a CStdStringA
04137 //    object with a single line of code.
04138 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04139 
04140 inline CStdStringA WUFormatA(PCSTR szFormat, ...)
04141 {
04142   va_list argList;
04143   va_start(argList, szFormat);
04144   CStdStringA strOut;
04145   strOut.FormatV(szFormat, argList);
04146   va_end(argList);
04147   return strOut;
04148 }
04149 inline CStdStringW WUFormatW(PCWSTR szwFormat, ...)
04150 {
04151   va_list argList;
04152   va_start(argList, szwFormat);
04153   CStdStringW strOut;
04154   strOut.FormatV(szwFormat, argList);
04155   va_end(argList);
04156   return strOut;
04157 }
04158 #ifdef SS_ANSI
04159 #else
04160   inline CStdStringA WUFormatA(UINT nId, ...)
04161   {
04162     va_list argList;
04163     va_start(argList, nId);
04164 
04165     CStdStringA strFmt;
04166     CStdStringA strOut;
04167     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
04168       strOut.FormatV(strFmt, argList);
04169 
04170     va_end(argList);
04171     return strOut;
04172   }
04173 
04174   inline CStdStringW WUFormatW(UINT nId, ...)
04175   {
04176     va_list argList;
04177     va_start(argList, nId);
04178 
04179     CStdStringW strFmt;
04180     CStdStringW strOut;
04181     if ( strFmt.Load(nId) )
04182       strOut.FormatV(strFmt, argList);
04183 
04184     va_end(argList);
04185     return strOut;
04186   }
04187 #endif // #ifdef SS_ANSI
04188 
04189 
04190 
04191 #if defined(SS_WIN32) && !defined (SS_ANSI)
04192   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
04193   // FUNCTION: WUSysMessage
04194   //   CStdStringA WUSysMessageA(DWORD dwError, DWORD dwLangId=SS_DEFLANGID);
04195   //   CStdStringW WUSysMessageW(DWORD dwError, DWORD dwLangId=SS_DEFLANGID);
04196   //           
04197   // DESCRIPTION:
04198   //   This function simplifies the process of obtaining a string equivalent
04199   //   of a system error code returned from GetLastError().  You simply
04200   //   supply the value returned by GetLastError() to this function and the
04201   //   corresponding system string is returned in the form of a CStdStringA.
04202   //
04203   // PARAMETERS: 
04204   //   dwError - a DWORD value representing the error code to be translated
04205   //   dwLangId - the language id to use.  defaults to english.
04206   //
04207   // RETURN VALUE: 
04208   //   a CStdStringA equivalent of the error code.  Currently, this function
04209   //   only returns either English of the system default language strings.  
04210   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
04211   #define SS_DEFLANGID MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL,SUBLANG_DEFAULT)
04212   inline CStdStringA WUSysMessageA(DWORD dwError, DWORD dwLangId=SS_DEFLANGID)
04213   {
04214     CHAR szBuf[512];
04215 
04216     if ( 0 != ::FormatMessageA(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, NULL, dwError,
04217                    dwLangId, szBuf, 511, NULL) )
04218       return WUFormatA("%s (0x%X)", szBuf, dwError);
04219     else
04220       return WUFormatA("Unknown error (0x%X)", dwError);
04221   }
04222   inline CStdStringW WUSysMessageW(DWORD dwError, DWORD dwLangId=SS_DEFLANGID)
04223   {
04224     WCHAR szBuf[512];
04225 
04226     if ( 0 != ::FormatMessageW(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, NULL, dwError,
04227                    dwLangId, szBuf, 511, NULL) )
04228       return WUFormatW(L"%s (0x%X)", szBuf, dwError);
04229     else
04230       return WUFormatW(L"Unknown error (0x%X)", dwError);
04231   }
04232 #endif
04233 
04234 // Define TCHAR based friendly names for some of these functions
04235 
04236 #ifdef UNICODE
04237   //#define CStdString        CStdStringW
04238   typedef CStdStringW       CStdString;
04239   #define WUSysMessage      WUSysMessageW
04240   #define WUFormat        WUFormatW
04241 #else
04242   //#define CStdString        CStdStringA
04243   typedef CStdStringA       CStdString;
04244   #define WUSysMessage      WUSysMessageA
04245   #define WUFormat        WUFormatA
04246 #endif
04247 
04248 // ...and some shorter names for the space-efficient
04249 
04250 #define WUSysMsg          WUSysMessage
04251 #define WUSysMsgA         WUSysMessageA
04252 #define WUSysMsgW         WUSysMessageW
04253 #define WUFmtA            WUFormatA
04254 #define WUFmtW            WUFormatW
04255 #define WUFmt           WUFormat
04256 #define WULastErrMsg()        WUSysMessage(::GetLastError())
04257 #define WULastErrMsgA()       WUSysMessageA(::GetLastError())
04258 #define WULastErrMsgW()       WUSysMessageW(::GetLastError())
04259 
04260 
04261 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04262 // FUNCTIONAL COMPARATORS:
04263 // REMARKS:
04264 //    These structs are derived from the std::binary_function template.  They
04265 //    give us functional classes (which may be used in Standard C++ Library
04266 //    collections and algorithms) that perform case-insensitive comparisons of
04267 //    CStdString objects.  This is useful for maps in which the key may be the
04268 //     proper string but in the wrong case.
04269 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04270 #define StdStringLessNoCaseW    SSLNCW  // avoid VC compiler warning 4786
04271 #define StdStringEqualsNoCaseW    SSENCW    
04272 #define StdStringLessNoCaseA    SSLNCA    
04273 #define StdStringEqualsNoCaseA    SSENCA    
04274 
04275 #ifdef UNICODE
04276   #define StdStringLessNoCase   SSLNCW    
04277   #define StdStringEqualsNoCase SSENCW    
04278 #else
04279   #define StdStringLessNoCase   SSLNCA    
04280   #define StdStringEqualsNoCase SSENCA    
04281 #endif
04282 
04283 struct StdStringLessNoCaseW
04284   : std::binary_function<CStdStringW, CStdStringW, bool>
04285 {
04286   inline
04287   bool operator()(const CStdStringW& sLeft, const CStdStringW& sRight) const
04288   { return ssicmp(sLeft.c_str(), sRight.c_str()) < 0; }
04289 };
04290 struct StdStringEqualsNoCaseW
04291   : std::binary_function<CStdStringW, CStdStringW, bool>
04292 {
04293   inline
04294   bool operator()(const CStdStringW& sLeft, const CStdStringW& sRight) const
04295   { return ssicmp(sLeft.c_str(), sRight.c_str()) == 0; }
04296 };
04297 struct StdStringLessNoCaseA
04298   : std::binary_function<CStdStringA, CStdStringA, bool>
04299 {
04300   inline
04301   bool operator()(const CStdStringA& sLeft, const CStdStringA& sRight) const
04302   { return ssicmp(sLeft.c_str(), sRight.c_str()) < 0; }
04303 };
04304 struct StdStringEqualsNoCaseA
04305   : std::binary_function<CStdStringA, CStdStringA, bool>
04306 {
04307   inline
04308   bool operator()(const CStdStringA& sLeft, const CStdStringA& sRight) const
04309   { return ssicmp(sLeft.c_str(), sRight.c_str()) == 0; }
04310 };
04311 
04312 // If we had to define our own version of TRACE above, get rid of it now
04313 
04314 #ifdef TRACE_DEFINED_HERE
04315   #undef TRACE
04316   #undef TRACE_DEFINED_HERE
04317 #endif

04329 //  inline void swap(CStdStringW& s1, CStdStringW& s2) throw()
04330 //  {
